result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Plea Addendum

Plea Agreement

Defendant Rahul Singh appeared by video.  Attorney Vincent Hauser appeared by video for Rahul Singh.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference.  
Defense requests resolution date.
Case adjourned to Branch 15.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Rahul Singh appeared by video.  Attorney Vincent Hauser appeared by video for Rahul Singh.  Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held off the record due to no court reporter availability. Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 15 via Zoom.
Status conference 10-11-2022 at 9:00 am.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. 
Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY. 
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 8/27/22. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Rahul Singh in court.  Attorney Vincent Hauser in court for Rahul Singh.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  
Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 15.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
